title: Evaluating a classification pipeline
content_paraphrase: Scenario describes a binary classifier with separate train, validation, and test splits. Students must interpret confusion matrices, discuss class imbalance, and recommend adjustments to improve performance on minority cases.
solution_outline: Compute precision and recall for each class, highlight imbalance effects, propose resampling or adjusted decision thresholds, and mention cross-validation for robustness.

title: Improper integral with convergence test
content_paraphrase: Given an improper integral of a rational function over [1, âˆž), determine whether it converges and compute the value when it does. Emphasises applying comparison tests and partial fractions.
solution_outline: Check convergence near infinity by comparing with 1/x^2. Split the fraction, integrate term by term, and evaluate the limit.

title: Bayes theorem with screening test
content_paraphrase: A medical screening test with stated sensitivity and specificity is used in a population where disease prevalence is low. Compute the positive predictive value after one positive test and comment on why it differs from sensitivity.
solution_outline: Use Bayes' theorem with total probability in the denominator. Express the posterior in terms of prevalence, sensitivity, and false positive rate, then evaluate numerically.
